channel.title: Precipitation on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Precipitation on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: a wet month here, a dry month elsewhere
item.description: About this analysis, from the Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service of the National Weather Service : “Observed” data is a byproduct of National Weather Service (NWS) operations at the 12 CONUS River Forecast Centers (RFCs), and is displayed as a gridded field with a spatial resolution of roughly 4x4 km. “Observed” data is expressed as a 24-hour total ending at 1200 Z (same as Greenwich Mean Time, or GMT), with longer periods simply being a summation of multiple 24-hour periods.
